name: 221B Baker Street
description: Holmes and Watson's lodgings, a domestic interior turned war room of maps, clippings, and string. In Act I, it appears first in early morning light, then later as a rain-drummed night of intense theorizing.
atmosphere: Domestic familiarity tainted by intellectual mania; the ticking clock sounds like distant footsteps.

name: Scotland Yard – Records and Evidence
description: A paper maze under gaslight, smelling of ink, damp wool, and stale tobacco. Constables whisper about the 'ghost ledger' and evidence that never reaches trial.
atmosphere: Institutional, secretive, shadowed by bureaucracy and half-spoken conspiracies.

name: St. Bartholomew’s Hospital – Anatomy Theatre
description: A chilled anatomy theatre with sawdust damp from carbolic, a cadaver half-shrouded in muslin, and Tobias Greel lecturing above it in a blood-speckled apron.
atmosphere: Clinical, morbid, detached; the line between curiosity and cruelty is blurred.

name: Whitechapel Streets
description: Narrow streets soaked in drizzle, gaslight flickering on wet cobbles. At night, a phantom coach moves through fog-slick alleys, its lantern burning sickly green.
atmosphere: Oppressive, labyrinthine, haunted by poverty, fear, and rumor.

name: The Coachman’s Route (Abstracted)
description: A conceptual node representing the remembered route of the masked coachman through Whitechapel — not a navigable grid, but a mental map of turns, shortcuts, and the final approach to the river stairs.
atmosphere: Fragmentary, half-remembered, tinged with hallucination when Watson’s mind is strained.
